messages.message:
Hi! I wanted to check if there was a way to resolve this issue. On Crafting, I keep getting errors such as the following (`[container name] is already in use`). The only consistent way I've found to fix this sort of issue is restarting the sandbox. `docker rm -f [container name]` doesn't seem to work. `cs restart` (with or without the container name) is also not doing the job.
```mkdir -p /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/tmp/hotconfig && touch /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/tmp/hotconfig/base-hot-config.yml
CONFIG_NAME=docker-local \
python /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/stack-local/get-env-local.py \
/home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/deployment/env/deployment-config.json \
/home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local.json /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local-secrets.json /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local-crafting.json /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local-feature-flags.json /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/env-local-overrides.json > /home/owner/instabase/core-services/job-service/tmp/docker_env_local.list
docker: Error response from daemon: Conflict. The container name "/instabase-job-service" is already in use by container "e8da4d6bda06c47b31c5458ff68e503123e5ab03d9424b0844f33f36b42766f7". You have to remove (or rename) that container to be able to reuse that name.```
For me `docker rm -f <container_id>` works but sometimes even that gets stuck for some reason. Then I usually just run `docker system prune -f` to remove the container stuck in created mode.
I'll try the two commands next time I run into this issue. However, this seems like something we would want to include in `cs restart <service name>`
`docker system prune -f` will delete a lot of things! so that definitely shouldn't be included in `cs restart <service name>`
Yeah, I'm not sure why this happens sometimes...must be a docker daemon bug. We always to `docker run --rm` which is supposed to delete the container on exit.
